Question: Can I delete my old calendar history?
Title: Privacy FAQ
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: Yes, you can delete your calendar events one by one, by date range, or all at once by visiting the Calendar section in the Alexa app or on the Amazon website. You can also choose to have your calendar events older than 3 or 18 months deleted automatically.

Question: Do I have choice or control options for my contacts' information?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: Yes, you can manage your contacts in the "Your Account" section of the website. You can add, update, or delete contacts. If you don't want Alexa to call or message your contacts, you can disable the feature in the Alexa app or website.

Question: Can I hide my email address?
Title: Privacy FAQ
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: You can manage your email address and other contact information in the "Contact Information" section of the "Your Account" page on the Amazon website. You can also choose to use an alias or a phone number instead of your email address for certain communications. However, you cannot completely hide your email address as it is required for certain Amazon services, such as placing orders or managing your account.

Question: I want to edit my phone number.

RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: To edit your phone number, you can go to the "Your Account" section of the Amazon website and click on the "Contact Information" tab. From there, you can update your phone number and other contact details.

Question: Can you delete information about my time zone?

Question: Can you delete my voice recordings?
Title: Privacy FAQ
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: Yes, you can review and delete your voice recordings by visiting Settings > Alexa Privacy > Manage Your Alexa Data in the Alexa app or https://www.amazon.com/alexaprivacysettings. From there, you can delete voice recordings one by one, by date range, by Alexa-enabled device, or all at once. You can also choose to have your voice recordings older than 3 or 18 months deleted automatically.

Question: Are you sharing my age with others?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: No, Amazon does not share your age with others unless you give us permission or when required by law.

Question: Who can access information about my appointments?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: We do not collect or store information about your appointments. The information you can access in your account includes your name, address, payment options, profile information, Prime membership, household settings, and purchase history. For more information, you can refer to the sources provided.

Question: Does the company share user's contacts' information with a third party?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: Amazon shares customers' personal information with third parties only as described in their privacy notice. For instance, when you order products from third-party sellers through Amazon's stores, your personal information related to those transactions is shared with the third party. Additionally, Amazon employs other companies and individuals to perform functions on their behalf, such as fulfilling orders, delivering packages, sending postal mail and email, analyzing data, providing marketing assistance, and providing customer service. These third-party service providers have access to personal information needed to perform their functions, but may not use it for other purposes.

Question: Does it save my email contacts and sell it to 3rd parties?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: Amazon Europe does not sell your email contacts. However, Amazon Services may include third-party advertising and links to other websites and apps. Third-party advertising partners may collect information about you when you interact with their content, advertising, and services. This information may be used to serve you with more useful and relevant ads. You can learn more about how to opt-out of interest-based advertising by going to the Advertising Preferences page.

Question: Do you share my location with other people?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: Amazon does not share your precise location with third parties without your consent, except as necessary to complete any transaction or provide any service you have requested or authorized. For example, we may share your device's IP address with third parties to determine your approximate location, but we do not share your precise location. We may also share your location with third parties if it is necessary to comply with the law, or to protect the rights, property, or safety of Amazon or its users.

Question: Are you sharing my name?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: Amazon Europe shares customers' personal information only as described in their privacy notice. This includes transactions involving third parties, third party service providers, business transfers, and protection of Amazon Europe and others. However, you will receive notice when personal information about you might be shared with third parties and you will have an opportunity to choose not to share the information.

Question: Who has access to my phone number?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: Your phone number can be accessed by Amazon for the purpose of providing you with services and improving your experience. It may also be shared with third parties for the purpose of fulfilling orders or providing services on our behalf. For example, if you order a product from a third-party seller, they may need your phone number to contact you about the delivery. However, they are not permitted to use your phone number for any other purpose.

Question: Who has access to my time zone?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: We don't have access to your time zone information without your consent. If you've granted Alexa permission to access your calendar, it may be able to determine your time zone based on your calendar events.

Question: Who can access my voice recordings?
Title: Privacy FAQ
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: Your voice recordings are associated with your Amazon account and can be accessed by you through the Alexa Privacy settings in the Alexa app or the Manage Your Content and Devices page on Amazon.com. Amazon employees do have access to voice recordings for the purpose of improving Alexa's speech recognition and other services, but they are not allowed to listen to or retain your voice recordings without your consent.

Question: What does the privacy policy say in regards to saving my name?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: The privacy policy states that your personal information is kept to enable your continued use of Amazon Services, for as long as it is required in order to fulfill the relevant purposes described in the policy, or as otherwise communicated to you. Your transaction history, including your name, is retained so that you can review past purchases and what addresses you have shipped orders to.

Question: What is the latest privacy policy in regards to processing my voice?

Question: Why do you know my age?

Question: Why do you know my calendar appointments?
Title: Privacy Notice

Question: Why is all my contacts' personal information needed?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: We collect and use your contacts' personal information to provide you with features and functionality on Amazon Services, such as the ability to call or message your contacts using Alexa. Question: Why did you add all my contacts' phone numbers to my contact book?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: We do not add your contacts' phone numbers to your contact book without your consent. Question: Why do you know my email address?

Question: Why do you know my location?

RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: We use your location to provide and improve our services. For example, we use your location to determine the delivery address for your orders, to provide location-based services, and to personalize your shopping experience.

Question: For what purpose is my name collected?

RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: Your name is collected to provide, troubleshoot, and improve Amazon Services. Question: What do you need my phone number for?
Title: Privacy Notice

Question: Do you need to know my time zone?

Question: Why do you record my voice?
Title: Privacy FAQ
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: We record your voice to provide and improve our services. For example, we use your voice recordings to recognize your voice and respond to your requests. We also use your voice recordings to train our speech recognition and natural language understanding systems using machine learning. This helps Alexa understand and respond to a wide range of customer requests and improve over time.

Question: Can the assistant pull information from my phone's calendar?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: No, Alexa cannot access your phone's calendar without your explicit permission. You can link your calendar to Alexa, but only if you give Alexa permission to access it.

Question: Does the assistant have access to my contacts?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: No, by default, Echo devices are designed to detect only your chosen wake word and no audio is stored or sent to the cloud unless the device detects the wake word or Alexa is activated by pressing a button. However, you can configure supported Echo devices to detect specific sounds, such as the sound of smoke alarms or glass breaking, and if that happens, an announcement is made over the device's speaker and a notification is sent to the Alexa app on your mobile device.

Question: Do you know my phone number?

Question: How do you process my audio recordings?
Title: Privacy FAQ
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: When you make a request to Alexa, a recording of your request is sent to Amazon's cloud, where we process your request and other information to respond to you. For example, when you ask, "Alexa, play top hits on Amazon Music," we use the recording of your request and information from Amazon Music to play top hits.

Question: Does the assistant turn on my mic without my knowledge?
Title: Privacy FAQ
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: No, the assistant does not turn on your mic without your knowledge. By default, Echo devices are designed to detect only your chosen wake word. They detect the wake word by identifying acoustic patterns that match your chosen wake word. No audio is stored or sent to the cloud unless the device detects the wake word or Alexa is activated by pressing a button. You can also turn off the microphones manually by pressing the microphone off button. When the microphones are turned off, your device cannot record and stream audio to the cloud, even when you say your chosen wake word.

Question: Is my calendar stored on the device?
Title: Privacy FAQ
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: By default, Alexa does not access or store your calendar data on your device. However, you can allow Alexa to access your calendar data in the cloud, such as from Google Calendar or Outlook Calendar, so that Alexa can provide you with calendar information, such as upcoming appointments and events.

Question: Do they keep my contacts' information?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: Yes, they might receive information about your contacts from other sources, such as updated delivery and address information from their carriers, which they use to correct their records and deliver your next purchase more easily.

Question: How long will my location history be kept?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: We keep your location history for as long as it is required in order to fulfil the relevant purposes described in our Privacy Notice, or as otherwise communicated to you. For example, we use your location data to provide location-based services, such as package delivery notifications, and to improve the relevancy of products and content we recommend.

Question: How can you guarantee my location information is secure?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: We maintain physical, electronic, and procedural safeguards in connection with the collection, storage, and disclosure of your personal information, including your location data. We follow industry-standard security measures to protect against unauthorized access to our systems. We also offer security features to protect your devices against unauthorized access and loss of data. You can control these features and configure them based on your needs. Question: For how long would my name be stored in the database?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: We keep your personal information to enable your continued use of Amazon Services, for as long as it is required in order to fulfill the relevant purposes described in our Privacy Notice. For example, we retain your transaction history, including your name, so that you can review past purchases and repeat orders if desired.

Question: Is the information on my time zone stored?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: Yes, we collect and store information about your time zone to provide you with the most accurate and relevant information and services. For example, we use your time zone to determine when to send you notifications or to display localized information.

Question: Do you store my voice recordings locally or on a server?
Title: Privacy FAQ
RAG+MultiRAIN_correctness_readability_MU: Alexa processes your voice recordings in the cloud to provide and improve our services and develop new features. However, you can turn on Do Not Send Voice Recordings on supported devices, so the audio of your requests to Alexa will be processed on device and not sent to the cloud. In this case, a text transcript of your request will still be sent to the cloud for Alexa to respond to your request, and you'll be able to review and delete those transcripts in your Voice History. Alexa will still send audio to the cloud for features that require the transmission of audio, such as when you make a call or send a message or announcement via Alexa.
